borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: The proposed dwellinghouse, for reasons of design and siting, would result in the loss of two off-street parking spaces, which due to the low PTAL of the site and the CPZ would result in a significant pressure on on-street parking, transport amneity and the highway. This further highlights the overdevelopment of the site. As such the proposal is considered unacceptable and contrary to:-National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)Policies T.61 and T5 of the London Plan (March 2021) Policies BR9, BR10 and BR11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)Policies DMT 2 and DMT3 of  The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

The proposed dwellinghouse for reasons of design, size and siting, would result in a significant loss of daylight, outlook, privacy, whilst also resulting in unacceptable levels of overshadowing and would be very overbearing for neighbouring dwellings espcially number 24 Marsh Green Road. Further, the proposal will double the the number of households on site, significantly increasing the number of occupants using the site. As such, given the sites location sandwiched between existing dwellings, the proposal is considered to generate more waste, light, noise, comings and goings and general disturbances than currently produced on site. The proposal is therefore considered to have an unacceptable impact on neighbouring amenity harmful to the standard of living of surrounding residents. The proposal is considered unacceptable and contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);

- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)

The proposed dwellinghouse for reasoning of bulk, mass, size, scale and design would constitute an unfavourable addition to the existing dwellinghouse, appearing cramped and subservient akin to a side extension rather than its own individual dwellinghouse.  Further, for reasons of siting and size, including the front extension, the proposal would result in a significant loss of the openness of the plot, creating a harsh built form and increased sense of enclosure. The lack of adequate on site external amenity space further adds to the harm caused by design and layout of the development. The proposal is therefore considered an uncharacteristic and unsympathetic addition to the dwelling detrimental to the property, terrace row and the surrounding local area. The proposal is considered unacceptable and contrary to:-

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)

- Policy CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)

- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
description: Demolition of existing sheds/outbuildings and the Construction of a new two storey 2 x bed dwellinghouse and side extension of existing roof.
